title: Immunity Debugger showing path instead of argv[1]

comments.text: argv[0] is the path to the executable AAAAAA is argument andtherfor it is argv[1] look at your code you are copying wrong  argument
@blabb How di you spot that so quickly. Thank you. That's obviously the issue
@blabb Go ahead and make that into an answer; comments are not a place to answer.
@blabb I don't mid accepting your answer instead of Igor's since you were the one actualy helping me solving the issue. It's up to you

answers_data.content:
To get the programâ€™s argument, you need to check 
argv[1]
instead of 
argv[0]
. From cppreference: The parameters of the two-parameter form of the main function allow arbitrary multibyte character strings to be passed from the execution environment (these are typically known as command line arguments), the pointers 
argv[1].. argv[argc-1]
point at the first characters in each of these strings. 
argv[0]
is the pointer to the initial character of a null-terminated multibyte string that represents the name used to invoke the program itself (or an empty string "" if this is not supported by the execution environment).
